FuncDef:
The port-mode card-id group-id command is used to configure the bandwidth mode for a special subcard based on the group configuration interface.
The port-mode card-id group-id command is used to restore the default switching bandwidth mode for a special subcard.
By default, the working mode of a port group is 25GE-10GE.

ParaDef.Info:
CardID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295 .

Group ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295 .

The type of the switching mode supported by the port.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To switch the bandwidth mode of an interface group on special subcards, run the port-mode group-id command.
An interface group supports the following modes:
25GE-10GE: Interfaces in a group support only the 25GE and 10GE working modes.
10GE-1GE: Interfaces in a group support only the 10GE and GE working modes.
25GE: Interfaces in a group support only the 25GE working modes.
10GE: Interfaces in a group support only the 10GE working modes.
